AI Projects

AI Research & Projects

Exploring the intersection of artificial intelligence with climate science and policy

AI in Climate Modeling

This research focuses on applying deep learning techniques to improve climate prediction models. By incorporating neural networks into traditional climate simulations, we've achieved significant improvements in prediction accuracy for regional climate patterns.

Key Innovations

  • Hybrid physics-informed neural networks that respect conservation laws
  • Transfer learning approaches for limited training data scenarios
  • Uncertainty quantification in deep learning climate predictions
37% Improvement in prediction accuracy
5Ã— Computational efficiency increase

Neural network architecture for temperature anomaly prediction

Related Publications

  • Manda, G., et al. (2023). Hybrid Neural-Physical Models for Regional Climate Prediction. Journal of AI for Earth Sciences, 4(2), 112-128.
  • Chen, K., Manda, G., & Rodriguez, T. (2022). Transfer Learning Approaches to Climate Model Downscaling. Neural Computing for Climate Sciences, 16(3), 87-95.

AI Policy Research

My work in AI policy focuses on developing frameworks for responsible AI deployment in critical sectors such as healthcare and environmental management. This includes addressing challenges related to algorithm transparency, bias mitigation, and regulatory approaches.

Research Areas

  • Comparative analysis of AI governance frameworks across jurisdictions
  • Ethical guidelines for AI deployment in healthcare decision support
  • Policy recommendations for ensuring equitable access to AI benefits

Proposed framework for balanced AI governance

Policy Papers

  • Manda, G. & Washington, L. (2023). Toward Inclusive AI: Policy Approaches for Equitable Innovation. AI Policy Review, 8(1), 24-36.
  • International AI Governance Working Group (2022). Principles for Responsible AI in Healthcare. White Paper.

Explore Related Areas

Biostatistics

Statistical methods for clinical and healthcare research

Epidemiology

Population health studies and disease pattern analysis
